content:
✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Might remove the 'ASCII ART' tag. Despite that, pretty cool and understandable !

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Wonderful puzzle. Comments below.

One very tiny edit: Please remove the spaces before colons:

The possible shapes are:
Coordinates:
One line:

✅ Approved the contribution.
Comment: Interesting puzzle. I'm surprised that there isn't already a similar puzzle, since it's obvious to think about it.

Solved. Where is the button to approve ?

I think it can be an easy one, since there is no optimization needed for big images. But I know that the boundary between easy and medium is very confused. In any case, there are easy puzzles harder than this one, and medium ones easier.

This might sound cheesy, but this puzzle really made me smile. These shapes are so simple, but I've never thought about how to properly distinguish one shape from from another strictly based on a coordinate grid. You are a legend among legends and this puzzle lives up to your reputation.

Since this is a WIP, I have a thought. How about adding "PARTIALLY FILLED", meaning the shape has at least one interior '.' and at least one interior '#'?

I did code up a solution. All the test cases look great to me. I have nothing to add to the @5DN1L edits below which it looks like you've already corrected. 

Great puzzle!
No ! There are enough ASCII art puzzle ! But OK, this one seems interesting to solve ^^ it's more image processing than ASCII art. Upvoted.

Goal section
* Please mention that the shape is made up of {{#}}.

* Please explain in what order the coordinates should be output.

* Please mention the format of the coordinates.

Input section
* You may format "." and "#" as {{constants}} and remove the quotation marks.

Output section
* Please mention "space-separated".

* Please add "The possible shapes are:".

* (19.0) and (0.19) should be (19,0) and (0,19) respectively.

* Please move the coordinate specification to Goal section as it is also part of the explanation of the input.

Constraints section
* Suggest to mention that there will be no ambiguous cases of very small triangles, squares and rectangles where it is difficult to classify as filled or empty (e.g. a square of 2x2).

Thanks.
Yes, all this is in progress, it's only a first draft ^^

Thank you for the compliments.
I hesitate to add shapes like parallelograms and trapezoids; but I don't want it to become a math problem!
It can be interesting, but it already exists (without trapezoids) : https://www.codingame.com/training/easy/nature-of-quadrilaterals
